project_overview.name: Customer Onboarding and Success Portal (COSP)
project_overview.description: A web-based portal that provides a personalized onboarding experience, self-service tools, and usage analytics for customers of the main SaaS product.

feature_breakdown.description: Allow customers to log in to the COSP using their main SaaS product credentials.
acceptance_criteria: Users can log in to the COSP using their main SaaS product credentials
Secure session management and token-based authentication

feature_breakdown.description: Display a customized onboarding checklist based on the customer's subscription level.
acceptance_criteria: Customers see an onboarding checklist specific to their subscription tier
Checklist items are marked as completed as the customer progresses

feature_breakdown.description: Integrate with the existing knowledge base API to allow seamless content searching and viewing.
acceptance_criteria: Users can search and view knowledge base articles directly within the COSP
Search results are relevant and up-to-date

feature_breakdown.description: Display a dashboard showing the customer's adoption metrics (e.g., daily active users, feature usage count).
acceptance_criteria: Customers can see their key usage and adoption metrics in a clear, intuitive dashboard
Dashboard data is up-to-date and accurate

feature_breakdown.description: Provide a 'Contact CSM' button that pre-populates an email or a Zendesk ticket with customer details.
acceptance_criteria: Users can easily contact their CSM with pre-populated customer details
Ticket or email is correctly routed to the appropriate CSM

technical_architecture.data_flow: User requests flow through the API Gateway to the appropriate service. Data is retrieved from the Subscription Management, Usage Tracking, and Customer Data Services, and integrated with the Knowledge Base and Zendesk APIs.
security_considerations: Implement role-based access control (RBAC) for the COSP
Use OAuth 2.0 for secure third-party API integrations
Implement rate limiting and DDoS protection

implementation_phases.description: Deliver the core onboarding and self-service features of the COSP.
deliverables: API Gateway and core service integrations

implementation_phases.description: Expand the COSP with advanced usage analytics and CSM integration features.

risk_analysis.description: Delays in third-party API integration and data availability
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Engage with API providers early, establish clear SLAs, and have fallback options for data sources

risk_analysis.description: Complexity of the personalized onboarding workflows
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Invest in thorough user research and testing, leverage low-code/no-code workflow tools
Implement caching, load balancing, and serverless architecture patterns

tools_and_technologies: AWS (EC2, Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, etc.)
Datadog, New Relic (for monitoring and observability)
Jira, Confluence (for project management and documentation)
infrastructure_needs: Secure, scalable hosting environment (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
Automated CI/CD pipeline (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions)

success_metrics.measurement_method: Periodic analysis of customer retention data
Tracking of first feature adoption timeline for new customers

success_metrics.target_value: 25% reduction in time spent on manual onboarding tasks
success_metrics.measurement_method: Time tracking and analysis of CSM activities

success_metrics.target_value: Increase to 40% of support questions resolved via the portal
success_metrics.measurement_method: Analysis of support ticket data and portal usage metrics
